title: Bats
body: Mammals of the order Chiroptera, of which two species are known in the archipelago: the *Vesperugo madeirensis*, found in Madeira and the Canaries, and the *V. maurus*, a European species. Bats are insect-eating animals that only appear at night, spending the days hidden in dark places, suspended by their hind limbs. The *Vesperugo maurus* is a larger and more robust animal than the *M. madeirensis*, as can be seen from the specimens that exist in the Seminary Museum.
